{{cpp/io/basic_syncbuf/title | sync}}
{{cpp/io/basic_syncbuf/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl | 1=
protected:
int sync() override;
}}
{{dcl end}}

First, records that a flush is pending, by updating the appropriate private flag.

Then, if the current emit-on-sync policy is {{c|true}}, makes a call to {{ltt|cpp/io/basic_syncbuf/emit|emit()}}.

Otherwise (if the emit-on-sync policy is {{c|false}}, which is the default), the flush is suspended until {{ltt|cpp/io/basic_syncbuf/emit|emit()}} is called, such as through {{ltt|cpp/io/basic_osyncstream/emit|std::basic_osyncstream::emit()}} or {{ltt|cpp/io/basic_osyncstream/~basic_osyncstream|std::basic_osyncstream::~basic_osyncstream}}
 
===Parameters===
(none)

===Notes===
{{tt|sync()}} or its equivalent is implicitly called by {{lc|close()}}, {{lc|seekoff()}}, and {{lc|seekpos()}} and explicitly called by {{lc|std::basic_streambuf::pubsync()}}
